Description: Lower grindstone of dark brown quartzite: very rough on the underside and edges, but ground smooth on the upper surface, which is slightly concave.
Curator's comments: Found together with 1912,1109.43. Bibliography: F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 13 and pl. II, 5, 7. For similar objects, see H. Åke-Nordstrom, ‘The Scandinavian Joint Expedition to Sudenese Nubia’: vols. 3:1 ‘Neolithic and A-group Sites’ (Stockholm, 1972), 121 and 3:2, pl. 190 (3,5).
Bibliographic references: Shaw & Nicholson 1995 / British Museum Dictionary of Ancient Egypt (p17)
